intro: Boswellia aspleniifolia, commonly known as the African frankincense tree, is a member of the Burseraceae family. It is native to dry, rocky areas of eastern and southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It produces a resin that has been traditionally used for incense and medicinal purposes. The tree is adapted to arid conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils.
